blog.name: bad-got-imagines
blog.title: game of (y/n)
blog.description: what if you, a 14 year old girl with no skill viable within this world, were in the game of thrones universe? what would the characters think of you? what house would you belong to? who would be your sibling, that would inevitably cause some kind of strife within your three day old relationship that has no chemistry or guarantee of survival, be? what are you doing here? all these questions and more are answered here. george is shaking. we're coming for him.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary:
You realise in the world of Game of Thrones that all characters are complex and morally grey? 
JOnsas: Yes. 
So you realise that...
body:
You realise in the world of Game of Thrones that all characters are complex and morally grey?

JOnsas: Yes.

So you realise that no character on Game of Thrones is perfect and that George has purposely created human and flawed characters?

JOnsas: Yes.

So you agree that Sansa has faults and Daenerys has some strengths?

JOnsas: Nonsense.

summary: I’ve discovered my third time drawing characters tends to be the one I’m happiest with. The Blackfish is no exception. I do love...
caption: I’ve discovered my third time drawing characters tends to be the one I’m happiest with. The Blackfish is no exception. I do love him so. I also love drawing the Tully sigil, because it’s the most pissed off fish in existence.

blog.name: thelastdragon6
blog.title: Stark
blog.description:
HERE TO HAVE A GOOD TIME

<a href=“https://thelastdragon6.tumblr.com/post/183831557809/master-list”>Masterlist.</a>

summary: The cold snowy air bit at your cheeks as you were looking at Winterfell from on top of hill. The last time you were was before...
body:
Winter came pt.1

The cold snowy air bit at your cheeks as you were looking at Winterfell from on top of hill. The last time you were was before leaving for Kingslanding.

“ i just don’t get why i have to go kings landing and neither does Arya it’s not like we’re bethrothed to the prince.” You told your mother as she was helping you pack.

“ I told you already you and you’re and sister can be part of the court. And maybe Arya will act more like a lady at kings landing.” Your mother Caitlyn Stark said.

Since you and Sansa were twins you both were old enough to start looking for a suitable husband and since Sansa was older by a couple minutes she got to be betrothed to Prince Joffrey. Good. You hadn’t liked him so you were quite relieved you weren’t the one that was going to be married to him. But your sister was which you also didn’t like the idea of. You and Sansa were twins but were completely different. For one you didn’t have the red hair like she had. You had long dark brown curls. And second unlike Sansa and more like Arya you liked swinging a sword and God’s were you good. Thanks to Jon he helped you in secret because he didn’t want your mother finding out. But unlike Arya you also enjoyed sewing. Sometimes.

~

“ are you okay my lady?” Podrick asked you. That made you snap back from your thoughts.

“ yes Podrick I’m fine I guess I’m just nervous to be going home. And I told you already you can just call me y/n there’s no need for formal titles.” You told him and he just nodded in agreement.

“ you don’t have to be nervous that is your home your brother and sister are there now.” Lady brienne told you.

You had left with them from Riverrun where you were hiding after your uncle the Blackfish had found you. You ran into him when you were first trying to go home. He didn’t recognize you at first but you did recognize him. Mainly because of his armor. After that he helped you by hiding your identity and helped you escape when the castle was under attack by Lannister men.

“ I know but I can’t help but be nervous I haven’t seen them in years. And I guess I feel a little guilty for leaving my sisters in kings landing.” You said as you were heading on your way again.

“ you shouldn’t you were young you couldn’t have done much.”

“ I guess you’re right.” You still couldn’t but help but wonder if you could’ve at least tried harder to at least find Arya. You knew that Sansa wouldn’t leave with you when you did because she was bethrothed to Joffrey at that time.

As you were getting closer to the castle you could feel your heart beating faster. Your siblings didn’t know that you were in your way since their was no time to send a raven and you couldn’t send one before.

~

You were waiting in the great hall for your siblings. Lady Brienne and Podrick had left you there alone so you could be alone with your siblings. You were next to fire getting warmed up waiting for them. What’s taking them so long. It seemed like forever but you finally heard the footsteps your heartbeat getting faster as they got closer and then door opened. And that nervous feeling you had disappeared as soon as they walked. You turned around and you saw them Sansa and Jon. Sansa looked older and like a true lady. Her look wasn’t the same as last time this time the way she looked sadder perhaps but it told a story of went she through making her look more mysterious stronger. And Jon he had scars on his faces but those also told stories.

“ y/n?”

You couldn’t help but run to your siblings and giving your twin a her tight hug. You two were crying but you didn’t care if they saw you crying . And than after a long time you went to hug Jon. He was stronger his embrace around you was strong like he didn’t want let go. You could feel a sigh of relief when he was hugging you. And you couldn’t help but cry even more.

~

You all were outside watching the snow fall in a comfortable silence enjoying each others presence.

“ I’m sorry Sansa.” You said she turned to look at you she had a confused expression her face.

“ for?”

“ for leaving you there with those people I should’ve went and gotten you when I left.” You told her. You could feel the tears running down your face.

“ you don’t have to apologize for anything it wasn’t your fault and I was a stupid girl then. I would’ve not left with you.”

“ I guess we were all stupid for leaving Winterfell.”

“ I want to scream at myself don’t go you idiot.”

“ how could we know.” Jon said. You three stood and once watched the snow in silence.

“ a raven came from the citadel. A white raven. Winter is here.” Sansa announced. After saying that you all couldn’t help but smile.

“ well, father always promised didn’t he.” Jon said while chuckling a little looking up at the snow that was falling.

.

.

.

.

“ for leaving you there with those people I should’ve went and gotten you when I left.” You told her. You could feel the tears running down your face.

“ how could we know.” Jon said. You three stood and once watched the snow in silence.

“ a raven came from the citadel. A white raven. Winter is here.” Sansa announced. After saying that you all couldn’t help but smile.

“ well, father always promised didn’t he.” Jon said while chuckling a little looking up at the snow that was falling.

summary: What is Dany's plan after she takes the crown?
question: What is Dany's plan after she takes the crown?
answer:
Her plan, I believe, is very simple. 

She will wroole.

There is precious little to go as to what she intends once she gains the crown. We really have only heard two policies, such as they are. She will ‘break the wheel’, and she will ‘leave the world a better place’. Basically, we are being asked to trust in her ‘good heart’.

I’ll try to nut out what ‘break the wheel’ might mean to her, bearing in mind she has no political or formal educational training, and so is unlikely to be proposing a socialist paradise. Here is the original quote in context:

Daenerys: Lannister, Targaryen, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell. They’re all just spokes on a wheel. This one’s on top, then that one’s on top and on and on it spins crushing those on the ground. 

Tyrion: It’s a beautiful dream, stopping the wheel. You’re not the first person who’s ever dreamt it.

Daenerys: I’m not going to stop the wheel. I’m going to break the wheel.

Daenerys lists most of the great families, but notice she omits the Targaryens. She sees these houses’ constant jockeying for power as an evil that needs to be eradicated. How will she do this? How will she stop them vying for power in the system that her own family created? The only way to break the wheel is to break those families’ hold on power.

Her demand that all the families of Westeros bend the knee indicates that she hasn’t given up on the feudal system itself. She just wants to keep the other houses subservient and relatively powerless, [ETA] and subservient to the Targaryens.

Daenerys has always had a fractious relationship with those in authority. I suspect this is in no small way attributable to insecurity. 

In Meereen she managed to alienate the entire ruling class by exacting cruel and random punishment against the Masters. She crucified 163 Masters, not because these 163 were guilty, but to make up the numbers to match child slaves who had been crucified. We know at least one was innocent. She fed a Master, chosen at random and without proof of guilt, to her dragons because she was angry at the death of Barristen Selmy.  She gave them no alternative but to rebel because they were always at risk from arbitrary arrest and execution without proof or trial. She did not rule for all, but only for the former slave class.

This is problematic because she needs people to help her rule, and the ones trained in administration are the very people she has real trouble recruiting or trusting. She could try to recruit from the lower classes but they would be very green and unlikely to have received the thorough education needed to be effective.

She is big on demanding loyalty, but a feudal system has reciprocal rights. This isn’t something she seems to really understand.

It is notable that until Jon joined her, her only support amongst the Westerosii nobles were people motivated by revenge. As soon as they were captured, she forgot all about them. She could have held the Tarlys and tried to ransom them in exchange for Yara. She did not. She was too focused on making a point.

Her ‘bend the knee or die’ message is exactly the same as that of Aegon the Conqueror. She has shown no inclination to make any kind of political change. It is still based on top-down intimidation based on overwhelming power.

Her refusal to name a successor also means that the form her government might eventually take is completely unknown. Will it be hereditary? Will there be a vote for the monarch or will there be a ruling council? Who knows? Even Tyrion is in the dark.

All we know for certain is she will probably attempt to rein in the power of the great houses so the crown cannot be challenged. Considering her heavy-handed attempts at ruling previously this will probably be by dictum enforced via dragon, rather than any type of consultative process. 

Finally, what does “make the world a better place” mean in practice? Again, who knows? She will rule for the small folk apparently rather than “roll over them” like the Cersei Lannisters of the world. This would have been a more convincing speech to the captured Lannister soldiers if they hadn’t just been rolled over, and if most of their comrades hadn’t just been turned to ash, leaving their wives widows and children orphans. The whole ‘bend the knee or die’ stipulation tends to drown out any good intentions she might arguably have.

Most of the captured soldiers were probably small folk conscripted to fight for the Lannisters. I wonder if they will be allowed to return home now to tell of the grace and mercy of Good Queen Daenerys. Probably not. They are probably “volunteers” in her army now. Probably only receiving food as compensation. There is a word for that.

It is telling that the only small folk we really saw during Season 7 were those Lannister conscripts. You know. The ones Daenerys swears she will rule for and make their world a ‘better place’. 

Daenerys is big on rhetoric, but ultimately all we have are slogans. Her track record in Meereen was patchy, to say the least.

The most troubling aspect of her future rule is her use of the Dothraki. Their culture demands that the warriors be given the freedom to rape and plunder the conquered territories. If they are to be restrained from this what is their reward to be? Will they be happy to be packed back onto a ship to Essos once it is all over with a little gold? What are their expectations? Maybe they will be satisfied with the sack of Kings Landing.

summary:
Sneak peek - Khaleesi inspired perfume - coming soon 
"Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, First of Her Name, the...
body:
Sneak peek - Khaleesi inspired perfume - coming soon

“Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, First of Her Name, the Unburnt, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains, and Mother of Dragons.”

Khaleesi’s fragrance notes are the desert ghost flower, blush pink peony, white amber, warm sands, sweet grass, and a whisper of tobacco and leather.

summary: [SPOILERS] Something to add to the prince that was promised theory
title: [SPOILERS] Something to add to the prince that was promised theory
body:
Many of you, like me, have predicted that Jon Snow is in fact the prince that was promised that will save the world. Only not in the way that you’d think. I believe the promise was made between man, and the walkers to make peace. They would provide/sacrifice a prince to the walkers every X thousand years in order for the night king to have an heir and in return they would return to the North. Thats the basic premise of the theory and now for some additional insight while rewatching the show.

It has occurred to me that the Night King knows that Jon is the prince that was promised. Why? Isn’t it strange how seemingly every time Jon ventures north of the wall, he runs into the walkers? Other rangers seem to come and go as they please without running into them. The wildlings by and large are either ignored or not full out assaulted. Yet when Jon goes to hard home weeks/months after the assault on the wall, the free folk are attacked. It seems like too much of a coincidence that the Night King would choose that very moment to attack. Just food for thought, it seemed to click for me- what do you guys think?



Source: http://bit.ly/2GzBpyV
